summary: An interactive command‑line shell that lets users explore an Ansible inventory and run ad‑hoc tasks or shell commands directly, with tab‑completion and a set of built‑in commands to adjust execution options such as become, verbosity, forks, users, check mode, diff mode and timeout.
business_intent: Enable system administrators and DevOps engineers to perform quick, on‑the‑fly Ansible operations without writing full playbooks, thereby speeding up troubleshooting, configuration changes, and routine maintenance.
